title: What is this cutout display serif font?
content:
![](http://web.archive.org/web/20141118174857im_/http:/typophile.com/files/homepage-text_4290.gif)

Found it on the Matches website. It looks familiar but I can't place it. Any help? :)
author: bakla

comments.content: Reminds me of Unger, but I don't think it's his.
Any Poster Bodoni with a white stroke added. Maybe?
I can see where you're going with that suggestion Miss Tiff, but the serifs disappear completely in many of the stems.

For similar concepts, see [Paul Barnes](http://web.archive.org/web/20141118174857/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Paul%20Barnes)’ [work for New Order](http://web.archive.org/web/20141118174857/http:/www.moderntypography.com/Lettering/NewOrder/index.html) and [Peter Biľak](http://web.archive.org/web/20141118174857/http:/typophile.com/wiki/Peter%20Bi%C4%BEak)’s [History 03](http://web.archive.org/web/20141118174857/http:/www.typotheque.com/fonts/history/03/character_set).
